organization.fullName: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

identificationModule.officialTitle: Dronabinol On the Pain Experience (DOPE): a Pragmatic Randomized Clinical Trial

statusModule.whyStopped: Study concluded because of drug shortage

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

leadSponsor.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

collaborators.name: The Eastern Association for the Surgery of Trauma

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to identify the effect dronabinol has on opioid exposure when used as an adjunct to the current standard multi-modal pain regimen (MMPR)

armGroups.label: Standard of Care
interventionNames: Drug: Standard of Care (acetaminophen +naproxen +gabapentin + as needed oxycodone or Tramadol)

armGroups.label: Standard of Care + Dronabinol
interventionNames: Drug: Standard of Care (acetaminophen +naproxen +gabapentin + as needed oxycodone or Tramadol)

interventions.name: Standard of Care (acetaminophen +naproxen +gabapentin + as needed oxycodone or Tramadol)
interventions.description: Participants will receive acetaminophen 1000 mg every six hours, naproxen 500 mg every 12 hours, and gabapentin 300 mg every eight hours. Participants will also receive Oxycodone 5 mg or Tramadol 50 mg every six hours as needed for breakthrough pain. Providers will have the ability to adjust this pain regimen based on clinical judgement.

interventions.name: Dronabinol
interventions.description: Participants will receive Dronabinol 10 mg every 12 hours scheduled. Providers will have the ability to adjust this pain regimen based on clinical judgement.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Total Morphine Milligram Equivalents (MME) Per Day
primaryOutcomes.description: This will be calculated by calculated by taking the total of MMEs from all opioids received and dividing by length of stay
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From time of admission to time of discharge (about 11 days after admission)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Total Morphine Milligram Equivalents (MME) Over Hospital Stay
secondaryOutcomes.description: This will be calculated by calculated by taking the total of MMEs from all opioids received
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From time of admission to time of discharge (about 11 days after admission)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pain as Assessed by the Defense and Veterans Pain Rating Scale (DVPRS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: This is a 4 item questionnaire and each is scored from 0(no pain) to 10( as bad as it could be, nothing else matters), enhanced with functional word descriptor anchors at each pain level and "traffic light" color coded bars to delineate levels of pain; mild (1 to 4, green), moderate (5 to 6, yellow), and severe (7 to 10, red) pain a higher number indicating more pain Average pain score during the course of the hospital stay will be reported.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From time of admission to time of discharge (about 11 days after admission)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants Discharged Form Hospital With a Prescription for an Opioid Medication
Number of Participants Discharged Form Hospital Without a Prescription for an Opioid Medication

Number of Participants That Have Incidences of Opioid-related Complications, Such as Ileus, Aspiration, Unplanned Intubation, Unplanned Admission to an Intensive Care Unit, and Use of an Opioid-reversal Agent.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From time of admission to time of discharge (about 11 days after admission)
From time of admission to time of discharge (about 11 days after admission)

secondaryOutcomes.description: This will be calculated as (30 days-length of stay (LOS))

secondaryOutcomes.measure: ICU Length of Stay (Participants With >0 ICU Days)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From time of admission to ICU to time of discharge from ICU (about 12 days after admission)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Days on a Ventilator (Participants With > 0 Days on a Ventilator)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From time of intubation to time of extubation (about 14 days after admission)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of ICU Free Days (Participants With >0 ICU Days)
secondaryOutcomes.description: This will be calculated as (30 days-number of days in ICU)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Ventilator Free Days (Participants With >0 Days on a Ventilator)
secondaryOutcomes.description: This will be calculated as (30 days-number of days spent on ventilator)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* patients admitted to the floor, Surgical Intermediate Medical Unit (SIMU), Shock-Trauma ICU (STICU) at Memorial Herman Hospital-Texas Medical Center(MHH-TMC)

Exclusion Criteria:

* Pregnant
* Prisoner
* Patients placed in observation unit
* Non-acute trauma
* Admitted with primary burn injury
* Expired prior to admission
* Moribund
* Discharge from emergency department
* Left against medical advice

overallOfficials.name: John Harvin, MD, FACS
overallOfficials.affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

locations.facility: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston

groups.title: Standard of Care
groups.description: Standard of Care (acetaminophen +naproxen +gabapentin + as needed oxycodone or Tramadol): Participants will receive acetaminophen 1000 mg every six hours, naproxen 500 mg every 12 hours, and gabapentin 300 mg every eight hours. Participants will also receive Oxycodone 5 mg or Tramadol 50 mg every six hours as needed for breakthrough pain. Providers will have the ability to adjust this pain regimen based on clinical judgement.

groups.title: Standard of Care + Dronabinol
groups.description:
Standard of Care (acetaminophen +naproxen +gabapentin + as needed oxycodone or Tramadol): Participants will receive acetaminophen 1000 mg every six hours, naproxen 500 mg every 12 hours, and gabapentin 300 mg every eight hours. Participants will also receive Oxycodone 5 mg or Tramadol 50 mg every six hours as needed for breakthrough pain. Providers will have the ability to adjust this pain regimen based on clinical judgement.

Dronabinol: Participants will receive Dronabinol 10 mg every 12 hours scheduled. Providers will have the ability to adjust this pain regimen based on clinical judgement.

groups.title: Total
groups.description: Total of all reporting groups

measures.title: Age, Continuous
Sex: Female, Male
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Region of Enrollment
Score on Abbreviated Injury Scale (AIS) - Head
measures.description: The AIS classifies individual injuries by body region as follows: 0 = No Injury; 1 = Minor; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Serious; 4 = Severe; 5 = Critical; 6 = Maximal (currently untreatable)

measures.title: Score on Abbreviated Injury Scale (AIS) - Chest
measures.description: The AIS classifies individual injuries by body region as follows: 0 = No Injury; 1 = Minor; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Serious; 4 = Severe; 5 = Critical; 6 = Maximal (currently untreatable)

measures.title: Score on Abbreviated Injury Scale (AIS) - Abdomen
measures.description: The AIS classifies individual injuries by body region as follows: 0 = No Injury; 1 = Minor; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Serious; 4 = Severe; 5 = Critical; 6 = Maximal (currently untreatable)

measures.title: Score on Abbreviated Injury Scale (AIS) - Extremity
measures.description: The AIS classifies individual injuries by body region as follows: 0 = No Injury; 1 = Minor; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Serious; 4 = Severe; 5 = Critical; 6 = Maximal (currently untreatable)

measures.title: Injury Severity Score (ISS)
measures.description: The Injury Severity Score (ISS) assesses the combined effects of injuries in multiple anatomical locations and ranges from from 1 to 75, with 75 being the most severe.

measures.title: Number of Participants with a blunt injury
Number of Participants with Rib Fractures
Number of participants with flail segment
measures.description: Flail segment is the condition of having three or more contiguous ribs fractured in two or more places

measures.title: Number of participants with long bone fracture
Number of participants with vertebral body fracture
Number of participants with pelvis or acetabulum fracture
Number of participants with traumatic brain injury
Number of participants who underwent laparotomy procedure
Number of participants who underwent thoracotomy procedure
Number of participants who underwent amputation procedure
Number of participants who underwent any procedure
Number of Participants With Prior Opioid Use
Number of Participants with a History of Smoking
Number of Participants with a Positive Alcohol Screen
Number of Participants with a Positive Drug Screen
Number of rib fractures (all participants)
number of rib fractures (only participants with rib fractures)
measures.populationDescription: 102 participant in the Standard of Care arm had rib fractures. 100 participant in the Standard of Care + Dronabinol arm had rib fractures. This baseline measure is for participants with rib fractures.
